column4: which realtek card are you trying to get to work? if its the 8191/8192 the driver is currently in staging.
if that's the case you'll probably need to build a custom kernel from git
ouch! isnt that the same one you just warned me about? :(
Is that the PCI or USB version?

I don't actually use ubuntu on most of my machines, I'm a gentoo user... but to get my 8192SU to work, you need to enable the appropriate driver in the staging tree of the kernel config, then google for the firmware blog
ya but mine says RTL8191SEvB. does that have problems too?
it's not necessarily problems, its just that the driver is very new
so its not in the default kernel, its in the staging tree
if you have problems realtek is offering linux drivers here :) http://bit.ly/9PTbZv
they have drivers for the 8192 series also. surprised. but yet to search for my model :)
I have no problems at all
the driver in kernel supports 8191S/SU/SE and 8192S/SU/SE
ah ya point! you got me :)
guess i'll install those custom kernels then
Now going to install the staged version of the kernel from the git repo.
any page you can point me to to build the latest kernel from the git repo?
